intro.title: Recording Today's Wave
description: We often get swept away by a huge wave called 'anxiety' without knowing exactly what we're feeling in the moment.
But this wave isn't just one emotion; it's often a single wave made of many different feelings layered together.
Shall we take a moment to discover which emotions make up the waves rolling toward you?
intro.contentDescription: A practice of breaking down vague anxiety into specific emotions to face your true heart.
steps: 1. Situation (Fact): When, where, and what happened?
2. Thought (Thought): What thoughts crossed your mind at that moment?
3. Emotion (Emotion): What emotions did those thoughts make you feel?
intro.tip: Tip: 'Thoughts' are just like the windâ€”they have no substance. The key is to discover how you interpreted the situation.

step1.question: What happened?
step1.description: Record the facts of the moment your inner sea wavered, as if captured objectively by a CCTV camera.
step1.exampleBad: X: I felt pathetic because I was lazy and didn't study at all.
step1.exampleGood: O: I planned to study for 3 hours, but I actually spent all 3 hours on my smartphone.

step2.question: What thoughts crossed your mind?
step2.description: Write down the interpretations or thoughts that brushed across your surface, added to the facts.
step2.exampleBad: X: I felt a sense of failure and didn't want to study. (This is a feeling/emotion)
step2.exampleGood: O: I thought, 'I have no willpower,' or 'What if I fail the exam because of this?'

step3.question: What emotions did you feel?
step3.description: Select or write down the true identity of the wave or physical sensations brought by those thoughts.

step.placeholder: Feel free to write down the emotions you felt at the time.

result.title: We've discovered the true emotions within the wave
description: Now, this wave is no longer just a giant, mysterious anxiety.
The moment you gave it a name, the wave became a 'specific feeling' that you can face and embrace.
Shall we move to the next step and observe this wave as it is, without trying to suppress it?
